s: ^Not much, I'm just here to do some research on career fairs.
^You wouldn't happen to know anything about career fairs, would you?

LilaIntro: ^Lila?Smiling "A career fair, huh? Maybe I can help you out- I went to a few career fairs myself back when I was in school."

s: ^That'd be great! Do you know if she should be preparing anything before the fair?

LElevatorPitch: ^Lila?Smiling "She'll probably want to practice an elevator pitch for when she goes up to people. It should be short and to the point."
^Lila?Smiling "The major points to hit would be a personal introduction, what her career goals are, what her experience is, and what she would bring to the company."

s: ^Elevator pitch, got it. Do you know what she should bring to the fair?

LCareer1: ^Lila?Smiling "A little! I had to go to a few back when I was in school, but internships and everything were much less common."
^Lila?Smiling "I only was expected to do one internship after my third year. Now I know students start small internships after their first year!"

LCareer1.#: notification Lila_Day 1_Internships used to be less common

s: ^Gotcha. Well, do you remember anything about what to prepare?

LCareer2: ^Lila?Smiling "Oh yeah, sure! Usually you want to bring printed copies of your resume to the fair, that way you can hand them to potential employers."
^Lila?Smiling "It's really helpful so that they can get a sense of how you might fit in their company, and sometimes they even hand the paper copies off to their higher-ups at the end of the day."
^Lila_Day 1_Bring copies of your resume to the career fair_Elisa1

LCareer2.#: notification Lila_Day 1_Bring copies of your resume to the career fair_Elisa1

s: ^Awesome! Do you have any tips on conversation with the hirers?

LConvoTips: ^Lila?Smiling "It's important to have questions to ask them, too!"
^Lila?Smiling "Part of it is about knowing you, but a big part of it is also showing that you're interested or making a personal connection with the recruiter."
^Lila?Smiling "Get creative with your questions! Intriguing them is memorable and they'll think of you later."
^Lila_Day 1_Be sure to prepare questions to ask the recruiters_Elisa1

LConvoTips.#: notification Lila_Day 1_Be sure to prepare questions to ask the recruiters_Elisa1

s: ^Great! Any more general tips for success?

LGenTips: ^Lila?Neutral "Hmm... I guess just make sure to follow up with the recruiters after the fair, especially if you end up applying to the job afterwards!"
^Lila?Neutral "Might help the hirers remember you better when they end up looking over your real application."
^Lila_Day 1_Follow up with new contacts after the career fair_Elisa1

LGenTips.#: notification Lila_Day 1_Follow up with new contacts after the career fair_Elisa1

s: ^Great, thanks Lila!

LsegueOut: ^Lila?Smiling "Yeah, no problem!  Oh, and one other thing- confidence is huge for stuff like this."
^Lila?Smiling "I know it gets overwhelming with the crowds and the long wait times, but tell your friend that she's got this."
^Lila?Smiling "Plus, doing some positive self-talk before and during the event can really help keep your spirits high!"

LsegueOut.#: notification Lila_Day 1_Practice positive self-talk during the event_Elisa1

LsegueOut: ^Lila_Day 1_It can get overwhelming with all the people in the auditorium

LsegueOut.#: notification Lila_Day 1_It can get overwhelming with all the people in the auditorium

s: ^What's positive self-talk?
^Got it, makes sense!

LselfTalk: ^Lila?Smiling "Self talk is like being your own cheerleader. Instead of worrying that you don’t belong, you try to keep a positive outlook."
^Lila?Smiling "When I was in college, I used to tell myself, “You eat challenges like this for breakfast!” "
^Lila_Day 1_Telling yourself 'You eat challenges like this for breakfast!' is very positive

LselfTalk.#: notification Lila_Day 1_Telling yourself 'You eat challenges like this for breakfast!' is very positive

s: ^Wow, that's awesome!
^And that stuff works?

Lvisual: ^Lila?Smiling "Oh, and tell her that for another confidence boost, she could try visualizing herself as one of her role models!"
^Lila_Day 1_Visualize your role models for a confidence boost during the event_Elisa1

Lvisual.#: notification Lila_Day 1_Visualize your role models for a confidence boost during the event_Elisa1

s: ^Visualizing herself?
^Oh, interesting!

Lvis2: ^Lila?Smiling "Yeah! Research shows that if you picture a role model or a strong leader before an event, it'll help you feel more confident during it."
^Lila?Smiling "She could picture her role model before the fair, or even before she approaches a booth!"

s: ^I'll be sure to pass that along! Thanks Lila!
^Sounds good! I'll go tell Elisa- thanks for all your help.

LselfTalk2: ^Lila?Smiling "Absolutely! It's proven to up people's confidence. Oh, and tell her that for another confidence boost, she could try visualizing herself as one of her role models!"
^Lila_Day 1_Visualize your role models for a confidence boost during the event_Elisa1

LselfTalk2.#: notification Lila_Day 1_Visualize your role models for a confidence boost during the event_Elisa1

s: ^Visualizing herself?
^Oh, interesting!

Lvis3: ^Lila?Smiling "Yeah! All she'd have to do is picture her role model before the fair, or before she approaches a booth."
^Lila?Smiling "Research shows that imagining yourself as someone you see as successful goes a long way in terms of boosting your confidence."

s: ^I'll be sure to pass that along! Thanks Lila!
^Sounds good! I'll go tell Elisa- thanks for all your help.
^See ya!
